title: Pollen Data Challenge
description:
Description
A synthetic dataset generated by David Coleman at RCA Laboratories in Princeton, N.J
and used in the 1986 American Statistical Association JSM meeting as
a data challenge for the Statistical Graphics Section.
reference:
The first three variables are the
lengths of geometric features observed sampled pollen grains - in the
x, y, and z dimensions: a "ridge" along x, a "nub" in the y
direction, and a "crack" in along the z dimension.  The fourth
variable is pollen grain weight, and the fifth is density.

parameters.density: weight of pollen grain, a numeric vector
parameters.weight: weight of pollen grain, a numeric vector

format:
A data frame with 3848 observations on the following 5 variables, representing
ficticious measurements of grains of pollen.
